result.execSummary:
The defendant Jake Andrew Hersey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1000 fine plus court costs and victim/witnes surcharges are to be paid by 10-15-19; non payment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution set at zero.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

Court advised defendant he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10-15-19; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $570 entered as ordered by the court on 11/03/14 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 07/15/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
for Payment of Attorney Costs and Fees, signed and forwarded to the Clerl's office. sab

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 3 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-$1000.00 fine plus all court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10/15/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/15/2019; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-Court does not suspend his drivers license
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense needs time to go over plea forms with defendant. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 10/15/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
signed and filed.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court appoints Atty. Tom Hackbart to represent the defendant at County expense at the rate of $60.00 per hour. Defendant is to repay Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 8/15/2015. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 9/15/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 09-15-2014 at 08:30 am.
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant states he is still trying to obtain counsel.   Defendant states he would like to represent himself.  Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  

Information previously filed.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Defendant states he cannot afford an attorney, but did receive the name of an attorney who might be able to take his case at a reduced rate.  Court adjourns arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant informed the Court that he was unable to retain Attorney Joy to represent him at this time.  Case is temporarily passed.

Case is recalled on the record.
Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court with attorney Jennifer J Havas.  Kevin Shomin for Karl Hayes appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Arraignment scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court with attorney Jeffery A Joy.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court.  Kevin R Shomin for Karl Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant does not qualify for public defender's representation.  Defendant needs to hire his own counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court.  Kevin R Shomin for Karl Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Per the public defender's paperwork, defendant is eligible for representation with a fee of $480.  Defendant states he will make the payment.  Court refers the defendant back to the public defender's office for appointment of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.
  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-22-2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jake Andrew Hersey
Current: 1401 Lincoln Avenue, Sheboygan Falls, WI 53085   (Effective: 04-14-2014)
Prior: 1401 Lincoln Avenue, Sheboygan, WI 53081

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Jacob D Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jake Andrew Hersey not in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case set for initial appearance.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4-9-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
